channel.title: Client compiling
channel.description: how do i make it so its a closed source client so it loads from a .bat file and the people cant see the java or the .class files

item.title: Client compiling
item.dc:creator: @LOLMFAO LOLMFAO
item.description:
@LOLMFAO wrote:

actually de-compilers are easy to come across really. and it doesn’t take long to decompile all of those files. All you lose when you decompile are comments

Read full topic

item.title: Client compiling
item.dc:creator: @_Ryan3 _Ryan
item.description:
@_Ryan3 wrote:

Its almost impossible to find a descent decompiler these days. And I doubt anyone would decompile 63 files. Decompiling is never perfect either so… Yeah just delete the .java files and your good to go.

Read full topic

item.title: Client compiling
item.dc:creator: @LOLMFAO LOLMFAO
item.description:
@LOLMFAO wrote:

okay delete all the .java files now go and highlight all of the .class files right click and press properties you should see a thing near the bottom that says Hidden with a checkbox next to it. Make sure that’s checked and then press F5 or refresh and you can no longer see the files

Make sure you Don’t highlight the .bat files though

Read full topic

item.description:
@miyu_miyu5 wrote:

[quote=“I james I, post:2, topic:263833”]put into a .jar but thats too much hastle, just remove the .java files, and keep the class files, then it cant be edited[/quote]but if i take off the java files then they can easiely use a decompiler

Read full topic
